alert.note: Alert for Oregon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 5:49AM CST until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Oregon and Shannon. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 547 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding on Highway 142 in southern Oregon county from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with light to moderate rain still ongoing. Several rivers and streams in the warned area are rising. Additional rainfall of up to 1.0 inches is possible through early this afternoon. - This includes the following low water crossings... Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Rocky Creek at Highway NN, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Big Creek at County Road 390, Carr Creek at Highway HH, Piney Creek at County Road 228 and Spring Valley at Highway N. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thayer, Winona, Alton, Birch Tree, Eminence, Summersville, Koshkonong, Montier, Thomasville, Greer, West Eminence, Alley Spring, Teresita, Wilderness, Rover, Round Spring, Couch, Midridge, Akers, Myrtle, Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Echo Bluff State Park, Current River State Park and Grand Gulf State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
